title: Enhanced raw index readers/writers to support uncompressed data.
body:
Metric columns are good candidate for raw index (no-dictionary).
However, in the current implementation, random access of metric columns
is slow due to de-compression. This change allows us to support
uncompressed data in raw index form, so it can be fetched efficiently.

1. Added total docs, compression type and data start offset to the header. Adding
data start offset in the header allows for adding more header
information in future, without fixing where data starts.

2. Compression type is now configured by SegmentColumnarIndexCreator,
instead of being hardcoded. Also, make compression optional.

3. Bumped up the writer version to 2, and enhanced reader to be able to
read the current as well as previous version.

4. Added tests for un-compressed format, as well as for backward
compatibility.

title: Enable support for splitting predicate values for NOT-IN clause.
body:
Support for splitting predicate values (not joining using '\t\t') is
only enabled for IN clause. And to make this feature always on, we need
to first enable it for NOT-IN clause as well, so server side can be
backward compatible and recognize both splitted and joined predicate
values. Once that is done, we can enable the feature by default.

1. Added support in NOT-IN predicate to handle both joined as well as
splitted predicate values.

2. Extracted out a base class to move common code for IN and NOT-IN.
Renamed 'getInRange' to getValues() so it can be moved to base class as
well.

3. Updated test to cover the NOT-IN case.

Once server side is available to handle both cases, will file another PR
to enable always splitting the values.

title: Refactor RecordReaders, fix bugs and simplify logic
body:
1. Since we never allow null value in Pinot, remove getNullCountMap() from RecordReader
2. Make it extends Closeable, and remove init() (init should be done in constructor)
3. Release all resources inside RecordReader close()
4. Fix PinotSegmentRecordReader to only read raw docs, and support no-dictionary
5. Allow reading compressed AVRO/CSV/JSON file
6. In Schema, allow removing an existing field (make backfill datetime logic much simpler)
7. Add CSV multi-value column support (add multiValueDelimiter)
8. Remove duplicate util classes and methods

title: [TE] Use dataframe in thirdeye response
body:
This is a refinement for the underlying data structure of PinotThirdEyeResponse. 

Previously, we keep converting the data structure for storing and processing Pinot responses. In this PR, we unify the data structure with data frame. The benefit of this migration is to give anomaly detection and RCA pipeline more relexibility to manipulate the data.

On ThirdEye, the data from Pinot is processed as follows:
1. Get Pinot response and store it in multiple result sets. For example, the query -- SELECT SUM(metric1),SUM(metric2) from dataset GROUP BY time -- returns two result sets. One for SUM(metric1) and the other for SUM(metric2). 
2. Join mutiple result sets by group-by columns to a single ThirdEyeResponse.
3. Align week-over-week timestamps by converting timestamp to index.
4. Evaluate metric expression (i.e., calculating derived metrics).

In this previous PR: https://github.com/linkedin/pinot/pull/2074, we start to store data in result sets using data frame in the abovementioned step 1. In this PR,  we join the two result sets using the nature of data frame and store the result back to a new data frame for ease of manipulating the data. Afterwards, we unify the timestamp of different time format (e.g., Simple Date Format, Epoch in 5-MINS, Epoch in 1-HOURS, etc.) to the same unit: Milliseconds instead of index, which require unituitive convertion in every subsequent usages.

The next step of this migration is to evaluat metric express using data frame. After that, we will be able to elimiate the difficult-to-be-maintained convertion among different intermediate data structures; which will be unified to data frames.

This PR only changes the underlying implementation and it has passed all existing unit tests. Also tested on local dashboard and controllers.

title: [TE] Add HTTPS client for Pinot's auto onboard of metrics
body:
Add a HTTPS client for Pinot's auto onboard of metrics. Currently, we assume that ThirdEye and Pinot controller are set up in the same network and thus we uses Accept All policy on the certificate for HTTPS connections (i.e., we assume that middle man's attack doesn't exist for now).

Test for HTTPS client is blocked by Pinot team's progress; HTTP client works as usual.

title: Handling race condition when uploading segments
body:
* Removed CRC check to reject segments if CRC same. We want to update segment regardless for use cases such as minion purge.
* Added a new field in segment metadata segmentPushStatus, which contains either an empty string or COMMITTING + time committed. We need time committed so that we can ignore segments that are stuck in the committing state and replace those.
* Changed RawTaskExecutor to include CRC

title: Clean up Star Tree specific configs in SegmentGenerationConfig.
body:
Consolidated the following three api's into one, as there were multiple
occassions where callers would need to call more than one of these api's
to get the same effect, which also caused bugs on a few occassions when
callers missed to call one of the api's. This change helps avoid these
issues.

- setEnableStarTree
- setStarTreeIndexSpec
- setStarTreeIndexSpecFile

The new api setEnableStarTree(StarTreeIndexSpec) takes StarTreeIndexSpec
as input, which can be null as well.

title: [TE] Anomaly Feed Implementation
body: This pull request is a part of the alert redesign. This feed aggregates the candidates from anomaly fetchers, applying filters and output the anomaly results to the next alert component, e.g. grouper. There are several alternative feeds can be designed. The basic one is the union feed. More complicated feed can realize the requirements like anomaly re-alert if anomaly gets more severe, and so on.

title: [TE] Add Serializer/Deserializer for TE ResultSet and Create Pinot query proxy
body:
1. Add serializer and deserializer for TE ResultSet.
2. Add Pinot query proxy to ThirdEyeAnomalyApplication. Now a worker could be used as a central portal to Pinot. Thus, other workers or dashboard could leverage the cache on the proxy worker.

Tested with new Unit test and local setup, in which a proxy worker and a dashboard server is started up. The dashboard server could get the cached data from the proxy worker successfully.

title: Enable Star Tree index when StarTreeIndexSpec specificed during segment generation.
body:
Specifying StarTreeIndexSpec during segment generation should imply that
StarTree is being enabled, otherwise clients have to specifically call the
api to enable star tree, even after setting the StarTreeIndexSpec.

title: Remove the API open() and close() in Operator
body:
We decide to remove these 2 APIs for the following reasons:
1. Currently we never call open() in the query execution path, but call close() in finally, which breaks the contract.
2. All open() and close() call are no-ops in all operators, and the return value are ignored.
3. For readability purpose.
4. No potential needs for these 2 APIs. Resource managing should be handled in constructor or nextBlock().
5. If in the future we need an API to release resource (maybe we want to bring things off-heap), make the class Closeable.

Also simplified the APIs in the Plan.

title: Ttbach/search filter component
body: - Created search filter bar component to filter results in the events table - Moved caching to rootcause controller (filters cache and urns cache) - Moved filtering logic from child component to rootcause controller. TLDR; This is because in order for search filter bar to work, it needed a reference to all the filters that were selected from both the `filter-bar` and the `filter-bar-input`. For more explanation, see below: - Before, I had the logic for filtering entities by event type in `filter-bar` and filtering by subfilters (i.e. country) in the `filter-bar-input`, both of which compute the urns and send an action with urns up to the controller that resets the `filteredUrns` and changes how entities are displayed. However, since the `filter-search-bar` needs to know what filters were previously applied (for event type and subfilters), I thought a better way to do this is to have the controller keep track of all filters and process the filtering logic in the controller, so the sub-filtering-components (filter-bar, filter-bar-input, and search-filter-bar) just need to worry about calling an action that bubbles up to update the filters. - Minor bug: switching between tabs don't clear the input text in the `search-filter-bar`. For example, if i type "abc" into the search bar when I'm on the `Holiday` tab, it filters the `Holiday` events' labels by "abc." However, when I switch to the `Anomalies` tab, the search bar still has "abc", but does not filter the results based on "abc". Otherwise, it functions.

title: [TE] Append Pinot tables' custom configs to ThirdEye's dataset config
body:
Pinot stores addition configurations in table configs. Those configuration could provide the information regarding LinkedIn's Restli endpoint. In this PR, we start to import those configuration to provide more features for ThirdEye's Pinot client.

Test on local setups and new unit tests.
